Letar du efter ett spel värt att skriva en bra kommentar om har du hittat rätt! Jag tycker att Valve skapar spel med sådant innehåll som en glad sysselsatt hjärna förväntar sig. Snygg grafik och väl genomtänkta banor som ger mig ett beroende jag sällan känner av. Pussel blandat med intriger, drama och känslan av att kunna "röra" sig fritt i "buren" ger mig övertygelse av vilka som är Spelutvecklarkungar. Mina damer och herrar, jag är synsk! Först spelar du Portal och sedan spelar du Portal 2 ;)

Bazı puzzle odaları kafayı yedirtse de inanılmaz zevk alarak oynadığım sayılı oyunlardan biri ve kesinlikle oynamaya değer. Çıkış zamanını da göz önüne alırsak, Valve gene şaşırtmadı ve zamanının çok ötesinde oynanış ve senaryoya sahip bir oyun ortaya koymuş. Oyunda extra grafik, hikaye, acsiyon vs. aramayın. Tamamen sakin ve sapına kadar stratejik zeka isteyen bir oyun. Oynarken hiç sıkılmadım ama ara ara sinirlendiğim oldu :P (puzzle çözemeyince) Kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

Sayısal değerlendirmem:

1. Kullanıcı Arayüzü: 8/10
2. Menü: 8/10
3. Grafikler: 9/10
4. Hikâye: 10/10
5. Senaryo: 10/10
6. Müzikler: 9/10
7. Sahneler: 8/10
8. Mekanik: 9/10
9. SFX: 9/10
10. Oynanış: 9/10

Toplam: 89/100 (70+/100 oyunları tavsiye ederim.)

Un classique du jeu vidéo :

Points forts :

-Gameplay et idées bien développés
-Un antagoniste pour seul interaction très bien amené de par son cynisme
-Une bande son agréable
-des secrets et une ambiance unique

Points faibles : 

-court, mais n'as pas été concu pour être un long jeu de toute façon
-le boss de fin trop facile

Before I give my verdict about this game, there is one fact about it you should take into account: it was originally released as part of a bundle called "The Orange Box". Portal was just a "side dish" in there - the "main course" was Half-Life 2, which is an FPS. 

This has two consequences. Firstly, the game is rather short - there are speedrunners who manage to complete it in 30 minutes or less, although your first playthrough will certainly be longer. Secondly, some of the puzzles in the last two-thirds of the game (from test chamber 14 onwards) require not only exact portal placement, but precise timing as well. The worst offender is the bit where you need to place a total of 4 portals in under a minute.

This game has a lot going for it - excellent puzzle design, great voice acting, amazing atmosphere. However, in addition to the drawbacks listed above, it is showing its age by now. 

So I suggest the following: If you are a puzzle fan, buy it bundled up with Portal 2, which has more puzzle variety, is longer and has a better story. If you are an FPS fan, grab the Orange Box. Either way, you wouldn't be disappointed!
